translated: the kinsman of Brahmā, of great fame,
the one called Kassapa by clan,
arose, the best of those who speak.
in the dispensation of that Buddha,
as a celibate for the rest of my life, after that I died.
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
I was a parrot in the forest.
a monk always delighting in jhāna.
With a mind of loving-kindness, compassionate,
with a mind for the welfare of all beings,
in that disciple of the Well-gone One.
Approaching the foot of the tree,

translated: sometimes I gave him food,🔽sometimes he taught the Dhamma.

like a guest going to his own home.

analyzed: samaṇaḥ tāpasaḥ vippo  paribbajo tathā iva aha
translated: An ascetic, a sage, a wanderer,🔽I wandered about just so;
I was one of many hundreds.
And in my last existence now,
in the delightful city of Kapilavatthu;
I was the son of Vacchagotta,
I was born to his wife.
while I was in her womb;
Near the place of my birth,
the intention was to live in the forest.
Then my mother gave birth to me,
As I emerged from the womb,
she received me with a yellow cloth.
I was a dear friend of his,

and again came to the forest.
that I was favored by Sumitta.

The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus have I heard: On one occasion the venerable Vanavaccha was living in the Bhagga country at Sumsumaragira in the Bhesakala jungle thicket.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā vanavaccho thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
